Sentencas: A multidimensional, model of non-isothermal planar solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) including detailed coupled mass and charge transport phenomena, has been developed.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The dusty-gas model has been used, in this a comprehensive SOFC model, and has been explicitly written/constructed, for the first time in the COMSOL multiphysics modelling framework to describe mass transport in the porous electrode and detailed charge conservation equations have been taken into account.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: As we have shown in a recent publication [9] the incorporation of the dusty-gas model results in more accurate predictions of the SOFC behaviour compared to mass transport models based on Fick's law or Stefan-Maxwell multi-component diffusion.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Our model allows prediction of the species composition profiles, temperature profiles, electronic and ionic voltage and current density distributions, and polarisation curves in a single cell.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: SOFC dynamics have also been considered including responses to step changes in the operating conditions.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model is implemented in two-spatial dimensions, however, the underlying theory is independent of the geometry used.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Extensive parametric analysis has been performed and the corresponding SOFC behaviour has been analysed through the resulting polarisation curves.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is shown that SOFCs exhibit higher power outputs at increased operating temperatures and pressures.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It was also found that the electrodes' porosity and tortuosity have a smaller effect on power output.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, step changes in the inlet temperatures were found to induce slower dynamic behaviours than step changes in the operating voltage.
Titulo: Parametric and transient analysis of non-isothermal, planar solid oxide fuel cells
